item.description:
Based on the popular Micro Armour: The Game - WWII platoon scale rules, Micro Squad: The 1:1 Scale Game - WWII is designed for both the history buff and the 6mm wargamer. Training, experience, and "cohesion" of players' forces are important factors in deciding the outcome of each battle.

The rules include:


 23 pages of weapons and aircraft data for the US, UK, France, Poland, Soviet Union, Germany, Italy, and Japan.
 Full color game markers
 Quick reference Combat Table Card
 How-to guide for designing scenarios
 10 ready-to-play scenarios


GAME SCALE: 1 miniature = 1 vehicle/weapon/infantry squad, 1 inch = 25 yds/meters, 1 turn = 1 real time minute

The Isle of Man TT races are held every year. The TT stands for Tourist Trophy. Bikers get to ride very fast around the lanes and roads on the island.

This game relates to their popularity. It is a relatively simple dice and move game, with certain spaces around the track giving instructions if you land on them. In addition, if two pieces end up on the same space, they are said to have crashed and must miss a turn. Also, if you roll too high a number when going round certain bends, you crash and must miss a turn.

First to the finish line, wins. If you want a longer game you can play on for whatever number of laps you choose.

ZeN is a connection game played on a torus, which can be visualized as a board whose edges "wrap" around to the opposite side. As in Quax, players alternate between either placing a stone of their color or connecting two of their stones diagonally. One player attempts to create either a vertical "loop" or a NW-SE "spiral" around the board, while the other aims for a horizontal "loop" or a SW-NE "spiral". Like in many connection games, draws are impossible and exactly one player must win.

Objective: find Jenny - caught and hidden by Bill Sykes - and be the first leading her home
 - simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -
1. find Jenny entering houses and flipping cards
2. announce if you found her
3. bring her home (house in Park Avenue)
4. avoid to be caught by players (loose a card)
5. avoid to meet Bill Sykes (drop a card)
5. don't eat too many hot dogs (forced by cards)

Objective: be the first to pass finish line (and learn more about the Euro-currency countries)
- 'Roll, Move, draw card, answer question & do what's requested' game -
game leads you through the 12 EC-countries with Euro currency
in a given order 
Dice ==> moving through all the countries, drawing cards, answering questions, confronted by barriers ...

name.value: Was lebt da in der Stadt?

item.description:
Objective: be the first to find all requested (cards) stuff (animals & plants) - learn more about your surrounding enviroment
roll the die, move around the board, draw cards fulfilling/finding the things on your to-do-list
proper method to learn, that there are more animals like cats, dogs, doves ... nice images

1 board
1 rules
4 meeples
1 die
5 replacement cards
6 'disorder' cards
40 animal cards

Objective: be the first to move all of your 4 meeples home
 - simple 'Roll & Move' game, similar to Pachisi -
 - moving by turn -
the game differs from Pachisi that the circle you are moving on is bridged (4x2 holes); if your die shows only small numbers or you choose the wrong meeple - it is going to fall into the river

item.description:
Objective; move Flocke, the little ice bear, onto your side reaching one of the marked corners 
 - 'Roll and Move' game, 2 players or teams, moving by turn -
each team receives 5 'action' cards; 
icebear is placed into centre of the board, barriers elsewhere

roll the die and move the ice bear into direction of your (marked) base line or move bariers or split number and move both
only vertical or horizontal moves are allowed
a '6' gives you the possibility to fly with the bear (blue fields only)
an 'action' card may be added to the number, but must be discarded afterwards
fields marked with a feeding bottle - if bear lands on it - give you an additional turn

Party game. Each guest gets a card that informs them who they are for the evening. In addition, the card tells them which questions they might ask other guests about who they might be. All questions must be phrased so that the answer can only be "Yes" or "No". The winner is the guest who has the most correct answers when the host declares the game is over.

Objective: be the first to collect 7 nuggets

place map into box and put your meeples on starting position (cooking cove)
knot your 12 strings to circles and put them side by side on the floor (carpet recommended)
distribute all the 12 'furniture' cards on the floor (like seen on the map)
starting position: cooking stove 
draw a card out of 48 - jumping position
do NOT touch the ground jumping from one to the other
successful ==> get 1 nugget
sometime you must jump carrying the monkey on your shoulder
you may choose for another jump (max. 3 jumps) but if you fail you are going to loose all of the nuggets collected during your turn
there are 2 different cards/levels regarding jumping difficulty/distance

content: map, monkey, 12 strings, 12 furniture cards, 4 meeples with 4 stand ups, 48 (jumping) cards, 30 nuggets

name.value: Fish Tales: A Flip Toss Game

item.description:
It's time for the annual fishing derby and you and your buddies have decided to make it a little more interesting this year by making a wager. Whoever catches the most fish doesn't have to buy his own drinks for the next year and there is only one thing better than fishing and that's fishing with free drinks.

Fish Tales is a flip toss game where each player takes the role of an angler trying to be the first one to catch 10 pounds worth of fish.

WHAT IS A FLIP TOSS GAME?

A flip toss game is a boardgame that uses a coin of some sort, instead of dice or cards, to determine different results during the course of the game. This is achieved by flipping a coin and trying to get it to land in a desired location on the game board.

From the publisher:

Developed over four years by the Father and Son team of Bob and Jeff Wiltrout, "Corner Kick!" is an innovative yet elegantly simple and straightforward game that produces not only games equal to the energy and excitement of the real thing, but even the elements of tactics and strategy that give it depth.

The rules have been extensively play tested and enjoyed at Conventions such as HistoriCon and Cold Wars for years, and they are now ready for you!

Besides the basic rules, there are extensive Designer's Notes which help explain the theories applied, and show how the actual tricks--some dirty!--of the game apply to the table top as well.

Playable with miniatures in several scales now available from a growing list of providers, the rules come with the full particulars of how to build your own "Pitch," Movement Sticks, and other accessories.

Two card stock Goal Cages for self assembly are provided with the book to start you off, as well as Team Rosters and a form for a play-by-play Game Record to note Stoppages and major events--a unique permanent history of your games and good times! A set of color Deflection Templates are included as well for determining where wild shots go, ricochets off the Goal frames, etc.

There is also a "Cheat Sheet" holding some 90% of all that's needed to play the game without having constantly to reference the rulebook. The 8.5" x 11" book itself is 62 pages, with three of full color photos of games and miniatures. Figure and other resources are provided to help fans of the "The Beautiful Game" get started immediately.

To quote from Bob Wiltrout's Introduction, "In our experience, people who play this game once play it again and again. In three years of play-testing, nobody has ever played Corner Kick and walked away saying, “This just doesn’t feel like soccer.” And I’m betting you won’t be the first.

You’re going to enjoy this!"

Subtilla is a two-player, head-to-head naval battle game. Each player has a sub, five boats, and a base on his side of the board. A player wins by either destroying all five of the opponent's boats, or by occupying both spaces of the opponent's base at the end of the opponent's turn.

Battles between ships involve dice-rolling, and the subs have special stealth, movement, and torpedo rules.

name.value: Eine Reise durch Sachsen: und Sudetengau

item.description:
Objective: be the first to travel to arrival point
learn more about folks and country 
 - simple 'Roll and Move' game, moving by turn -

rolling the die each player starts in Dresden
you can't kick opponents ==> your can't move if you would meet another meeple
follow instructions of field you land on - description/characterization of the place you reached is told
to all participants

remarks:
due to later occupation of 'Sudetengau' 1938 by Nazi Germany this game touches sensitive contents in the circumstances obtaining at the time

Plutocracy is a game with elements of business and politics. You are a serial investor starting and building companies. You can also collect political favors in various ways, and use those to gain an advantage to your own companies, or to slow down your competitors.

Plutocracy is a card game. The opportunities available to you in a given round is represented by your hand. Your resources are collected separately, as money and political tokens ($ and poli-chips).

There are free actions you can use each round if you cannot (or will not) play any of your cards. Events add some uncertainty. One event is the "End Game," which you can use to adjust the length of a game, by placing it in the deck either near the top for a short game, or near the bottom for a long one.

This game one of the many games in the Angry Birds Series.

Board game based on the bestselling phone app Angry Birds On Thin Ice. Players build structures and try to launch his birds and destroy the opponents' buildings. In his turn player draws a card and build the structure shown before their opponents launch Angry Birds in an attempt to knock down the structure to win points! 
Player with the most points in the end of the game is the winner.

Save the Angry Birds! The game of exciting skill and action based on the bestselling phone app Angry Birds On Thin Ice lets players build, launch, and destroy with fun features, including pigs with helmets, breakable ice-block building pieces, an exploding TNT box, and the large red bird character. Players draw a card and build the structure shown before their opponents launch Angry Birds in an attempt to knock down the structure-- and the pigs-- to win points! Includes 2 Angry Birds, 3 green pigs, a slingshot-style catapult launcher, structure pieces, and mission cards. 2 to 4 players. Ages 5 and up.

This is a game which was produced when Denmark reached their first European championship (EM).

The object of the game is to win the soccer match.
The 2 players agree before the game how long they will play, and then try to move the ball in a position where they will be able to score.

Each player takes a turn, rolling a dice. 
The player with the ball rolls 0,2, 4 or 6 enabling him to either move his players in position or dribbling with the ball (at double cost). After movement he will have to pass the ball at least one time (kicking it away if unable to reach a teammate). And of course score, should the opportunity arise.
The player without the ball rolls 0,2,4,6 or freekick. He will try to block the way to his goal. If he rolls a freekick, he will get the ball and start his attack.

The board is in the shape of a "Star of David". A path goes around the star and through the center. In the center of the star is a space marked "Heaven". Each point on the star is the start position for a player and is marked with a biblical person whose name starts with one of the letters in ISRAEL. Each player has a block that spells out ISRAEL.

Players roll a die to advance around the board. The spaces on the board determine what question based on the bible the player has to answer. A correct answer allows the player to roll again. If the player lands on a space marked with the name of a biblical person and answers a question correctly they get a chip to place on their block. There are spaces that give players the ability to remove a chip from other players or get a free chip. When a player has their block completely covered they must enter the Heaven space by an exact roll and answer a question correctly. If the player answers the question correctly they win the game. If the answer is incorrect the player must leave Heaven on the next turn and try again.

Essentially this is a rip-off of Trivial Pursuit.

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible, but don't miss to be back home on time
 - tactical (geographical) quiz - so called on back of box
3 phases - moving by turn - each player starts on his marked/coloured area
I move around collecting cards/images
II answer questions regarding images/cards you hold - if you fail discard card
III get back home (can be difficult) - don't miss the plane/boat 
content:
1 board, 60 cards/images, 6 ports/cards, 20 red chips, 4 vehicles with stand-ups, 8 'double-sided' stones to point out directions, 2 rain slides, 1 die, 1 rule
3 similar editions existing for France, Germany & US

Everyone is informed of the terrible cataclysm which endangers this little planet at the far end of our galaxy. We have to help the different races that inhabit it, as they have no choice that to seek refuge on new planets. Today, we learned that Earth will welcome 5 different extraterrestrial tribes: the Bloups, the Paroks, the Faars, the Mutas and the Napils. The issue is that no-one is able to predict how these 5 species will co-habit together...

The game is played in several turns, each made of 2 phases:
- New Flouks
- Entrance in the Village

Each player takes 4 cards, keeps 2 of them and give the 2 others to his neighbors. Everyone then choose one of the cards in his hand and play it simultaneously. The cards are resolved in the following order: Decrees, Flouks, Chief Flouks then Actions.

Decrees have an effect only on their owner: it increases the amount of a type of Flouks depending on a some conditions. The action of a decree lasts all game long and we can have only 1 decree per village.

The Flouks are only used to populate the village. The Chiefs Flouks can enter a village only if a Flouk of the same specy is already there. The Chief has a power which apply when he enters the village.

The actions all have different effects that apply only when they are played.

item.description:
It’s the 1920s. There’s prohibition and... sadness. The townspeople cry out for an unsobering savior! You don’t know the first thing about brewing, but there’s rumor about of secret distilleries deep in the forest. If only you could find them, you could caravan back these barrels of liquid joy and become the pride of the town. That is, if the other would-be heroes don’t get to them first. Do you have what it takes to claim that oh-so-coveted title, Regent of Rum?

If you like dominos, and you like mancala, then you'll love The Rum Run! At its simplest, this game entails building roads from the town center, acquiring barrels, and bringing them back. At its most strategic, you'll be at constant warfare with other players; racing them to distilleries, breaking their roads, building over them, and stealing their barrels. Be prepared to think not one or two, but six or seven moves ahead!

Originally designed especially for the Italian game shop chain Città del Sole, they used to give it as a present to children for their birthday.

There are birthday parties everywhere and animals wander to wood, pasture, house and pond to celebrate. The guest cards need to be deposited in the correct sequence at the party cards, the first player to discard all cards wins the game. The party cards are laid out, the guest cards are dealt to the players. In his turn a player must place one card and may place more. The first card next to a party card must be a 1 or 6, the following cards must be in sequence, ascending or descending. If a player cannot or does not want to place a card, he must draw a card, if the stack is finished he must place a card if he can.

Premise and Gameplay From Publisher: All the animals must attend the most correct birthday party: in the wood, at the farm, at home or inside the pond. But at the entrance they find a special command, so players must be really skilfull to try to get rid of all their cards, sending all the animals to the correct birthday party. The game mechanism is quite free and players will decide how many cards to play at each turn; they can even not play any card, but instead pick up a new one.

An educational game to promote the acoustic sound insulation. Ideally suited to school in preparation for kindergarten age amd is especially recommended for dyslexic students in early education..
Game is based on initial sounds. There are 72 cards and 4 cards per initial sound in this game. 
Ways to Play: Collect all four cards with the same initial sound or looking for pairs. Player who has most sets or pairs at the end of the game is the winner.

The Battle of Lobositz, October 1st, 1756
This was the first field battle between the Austrians and the Prussians in the Seven Years War.
When it became clear to Frederick the Great (Friedrich II of Prussia) that Marie Therese of Austria was building a coalition of nations to attack him, he decided to strike first. He invaded Saxony, trapping its army and knocking it out of the coalition. An Austrian army under General Browne rushed up into Saxony to try and drive out the Prussians and rescue the Saxons.
The two armies met at Lobositz.
Postcard game using one sheet for the map, few counters and easy rules.
With additional scenario and optional rules. A Must Have !
Suitable in solitary play.

name.value: G.I. World War II Tactical Combat

item.description:
Rules for skirmish combat during the Second World War.

Game Scale:
1 turn = 1 minute in terms of movement
1 figure = 1 vehicle or soldier (in general)
1 inch = 15 meters

Opposing forces are divided into two to four tactical groups (units) either by the players or based on scenario rules. Units are activated one at a time during the random activation process. Units are composed of one or more formations (squads, weapons sections or vehicles) and formations are composed of one or more figures. Recommendation is no more than four units per side to control the size and pace of the game. Each unit will be represented by a marker (a playing card, marked poker chip, or specially prepared index card) during the activation process.

A turn is comprised of 4 phases:
1. Artillery
2. Mark figures conducting supressive fire
3. Activation phase
4. Remove markers

name.value: Snake Oil: Das Wundermittel gegen Schlangeweile

item.description:
In the Old West, the wily snake oil salesman had a special talent, getting the most skeptical customers to buy the most dubious products. Now it's your turn! Invent your own zany two-word products – Rumor Mirror! Burp Balloon! – and sell them to all types of wacky customers. If the round's customer buys your product, you win!

To set up Snake Oil, each player takes six purple word cards. The customer for the round draws a customer card and announces it. Inventors quickly combine two purple word cards from their hand to form a crazy new product to sell to that customer. When ready, each inventor quickly pitches his or her product directly to the customer. The customer can end any pitch that goes longer than thirty seconds. The customer decides which product to buy and gives the inventor of that product the round's customer card as the prize. Inventors discard all used word cards and take two new word cards each. The player to the left of the customer becomes the next round's customer. Play repeats until each player has been the customer once.

Whoever collects the most customer cards wins.

item.description:
Pondus Pub is a quiz game set in the Pondus universe by cartoon drawer Frode Øverli. Each player takes turns in throwing a die and answer questions to be awarded with cheese pops, beer or red wine. These assets are needed to hit on the girls in the pub. Once you have gathered at least five of these assets (by answering questions correctly), you can try to hit on a girl. Each girl has different needs, so you might fail, and need to collect more alcohol and snacks. If you are caught by the bartender, you are sent out of the pub to go around the block and get some fresh air!

--

Fra esken: "Glem Robbie Fowler, Steven Gerrard og el Niño Torres! Hat-trick kan nå scores på en pub nær deg, nærmere bestemt Pondus Pub. Og vi snakker ikke om fotball, det er nemlig Jokkes bedrifter utenfor oldboysligaen som danner bakteppe for spillet. Holder du hodet kaldt, flaksen varm og hjernen koblet til ryggmargen, kan du bli med helt til siste runde. Spille skal svare på spørsmål i kategoriene: Fleip eller fakta, Hvorfor vet jeg dette? Rubb og rake."

name.value: Article 27: The UN Security Council Game

item.description:
Article 27: The United Nations Security Council Game gets its title from – yes, you guessed it – Article 27 of the United Nations Charter, which includes these two provisions:

1. Each member of the Security Council shall have one vote.
2. Decisions of the Security Council on procedural matters shall be made by an affirmative vote of nine members.

In this negotiation game, each player represents one member of the UN Security Council and will both present and be presented with different proposals.

In each round, one player acts as the UN Secretary General, presents a proposal to the Council and presides over a negotiation period that lasts no more than five minutes. The proposal will affect five issues – military, currency, etc. – in various ways, and each player has a secret document for the round that tells him how a change in each issue will affect him. All players openly negotiate on what they need in terms of points and bribes in order to vote for that proposal.

After at most five minutes, the Secretary General closes negotiations by banging his wooden gavel, then players vote yes or no on the proposal. Any "no" vote kills the proposal, as in the United Nation's actual Security Council – but vetoing a proposal costs a player points, so he might prefer to look for deals that will enable him to say "yes". The Secretary General scores a bonus when his proposal succeeds, so he and others who will benefit might be willing to negotiate to make the proposal sweet for all.

After each player has served as Secretary General once (twice in a three-player game), each player scores based on bribe money on hand, points scored from proposal cards, and how well the player fulfilled the secret agenda card he received at the start of the game.

name.value: Escape: The Curse of the Temple

item.description:
Escape: The Curse of the Temple is a cooperative game in which players must escape (yes...) from a temple (yes...) which is cursed (yes...) before the temple collapses and kills one or more explorers, thereby causing everyone to lose.

The initial game board consists of a row of three square tiles, each showing a combination of two symbols, say, two green adventurers or one green adventurer and one blue key in one corner of the tile. All of the explorers start in the center tile – the safe room – and each player starts with a hand of five dice. Each die has five symbols:


 A cursed mask – this die is set aside when rolled.
 A golden mask – each such symbol counteracts two cursed masks, either your own or those of another explorer in the same room.
 A red torch or blue key – these are used to enter rooms, access treasure, or activate gems.
 A green adventurer, which appears twice on the die – you need these to move from room to room, and to activate some gems.


Escape is played in real-time, with all players rolling dice and taking actions simultaneously. You must roll the right symbols to enter a room, and if you're at an open doorway, you can roll to reveal the next tile in the stack and add it to that doorway. Some rooms contain combinations of red and blue symbols, and if you (possibly working with other players in the same room) roll enough red or blue symbols, you "discover" magic gems, moving them from a separate gem depot onto that tile.

The real-time aspect is enforced by a soundtrack to be played during the game. At certain points, a countdown starts, and if players aren't back in the safe room when time is up, they lose one of their dice.

Once the exit tile is revealed, players can attempt to escape the temple by moving to that tile, then rolling a number of blue dice equal to the magic gems that haven't been removed from the gem depot. Thus, the more gems you find, the easier it is to escape the temple. When a player escapes, he gives one die to a player of his choice. If all players escape before the third countdown, everyone wins; if not, everyone loses, no matter how many players did escape.

Escape: The Curse of the Temple includes two expansion modules that can be used individually or together. With the "Treasures" module, some rooms contain treasure, and when you reveal such a room, you place a face-down treasure chest on the tile. Roll the symbols on that chest tile, and you claim the treasure for use later: a key lets you teleport anywhere, a path lets you connect two rooms that otherwise have no door between them, and a medic kit heals all players instantly (putting black dice back into play). With the "Curses" module, some tiles "curse" players by forcing them to place one hand on their head, keep mute during play, or otherwise do what you wouldn't want to do while escaping a temple!

item.description:
Affenzirkus is a dexterity card game for children.
The game contais 49 cards with animals.
All the cards are placed face down on the tabel. By turns, players draw cards. Thank, depending on the animal drawn, players have to do dexterity tasks. For example if you draw a penguin, you have to place the card on your feet and walk 5 steps without dropping the card.
If you succede, you get the card.
The first player to have 5 different cards is the winner.

item.description:
objective: be the first to put on Toni's shoes
 - moving/acting by turn -
each player places his meeples at one side of Toni's coloured segments
each player gets 13 shoes
roll the coloured die - step to the next coloured segment an put a wooden shoe on
continue - if the segment you stepped on is already equipped - bad luck
if the die shows white - free choice
winner is who puts on Toni's last shoe
variant: the one who puts on Toni's very last shoe (out of general supply) wins

name.value: Ran Sat1 Fussball Quiz Super Q

item.description:
Objective: be the first to pass the finish line finding correct answers to question cards
 - moving by turn -
each player rools with 2 dice
die 1 selects question card (difficulty level)
die 2 shows no of spaces to move if successful
special areas allow to move faster (yellow, red and penalty cards) 
answering questions for other players or combined activities are possible
remark:
'Ran Sat1' - this title was used for several games (Schmidt, Klee..) which can create some confusion

In Clocks you try to make the hours count, and the clock is ticking...

Each player chooses a clock and receives a number of coins. The start player rolls a number of dice equal to the number of players plus one, then divides them into groups. All players make a simultaneous blind bid on the dice lots, with the highest bid choosing first, and so on. Each player puts the purchased die/dice on his clock in a clockwise direction, gaining money, bonus actions, or both in the process. On each turn, a player may execute one free action, in addition to buying one more action.

As soon as the value of all placed dice match the numbers on a player's clock, that player wins!

item.description:
The Game of Photographic Memory...

Imprints is a trivia/picture identification game. Players try to earn a card from each of four categories, which is done by drawing from the deck, correctly identifying the picture on the front, then answering a trivia question related to the picture.

Worzle. The strategic word puzzle game. It’s cute and creative, fast paced and fun, and you might even learn a thing or two along the way. Two to eight players evenly distribute a total of 100 puzzle pieces. Each has a printed letter along with four wild pieces. Begin by placing a puzzle piece on the table. Start the timer. Taking turns, each player adds a piece to the puzzle. How the puzzle expands is up to you. Once every piece has been placed or time runs out, players pick up their pencils. Start the timer again and find as many words as you can. As long as the puzzle pieces are next to each other, any direction goes, however a player may not skip over a void in the puzzle to complete a word. When time runs out, using the Worzle Scoring System, the points are tallied and the player with the most wins!

Worzle is the next progression in word games. It combines the strategic component of building hidden words with the fast paced nature of finding as many as you can. It is not as simple as you might imagine. As the puzzle expands, pieces are placed in multiple directions leaving them upside down and sideways. Each player around the puzzle has a unique perspective of the game. The “building the puzzle” dynamic adds huge interest to the game.

Worzle will be packaged in a printed drawstring cotton bag complete with a timer, several custom pads and pencils all in a full color box.

name.value: The Ancient Americas: Cities of Promise

item.description:
From South America to Central America to North America there are remnants of large civilizations that have disappeared leaving behind only the ruins of temples, city structures and fragmented settlements. The Ancient Americas are shrouded in mystery and intrigue. The people were religious with a fashionable culture. Their cities were the central hub to life and these civilizations enjoyed much abundance and prosperity all while in the midst of conflicts that were trying to destroy them.

General Rules

This game is for 2 to 4 players ages eight to adult. Players build a 'city of promise' by building their civilization with important structures and with valuable characters that then defend the city from corruption's power.

Building Cards - Throughout the deck are Building Cards. To build structures for the 'cities of promise' and to use important historical figures within the cities, a player must try to collect specific cards and in the right amounts. Some cards cost more than others and the value of the cards vary in power. Players who gain the right building cards pay the cost of the card and a new part of the city is then added.

Game Timer - Corruption Cards play as timing cards and determine when the game ends. When the 18th Corruption Card is placed down the game ends for all players.

Each player add up their cities power points. If the total is greater than the total points of Corruption Power Points then they have WON! Yes, that's right, there can be more than one winner in this game making it more rewarding for the whole family. And if the friendly competition is that HIGH you can find out who's city had the most strength and they can be the Grand Winner!

Types of Cards

Corruption Cards - New cards are drawn at the beginning of every turn. Any time a Corruption Card is drawn it must be played during the player's turn and added to the Corruption Card area (typically the middle between all players).

Building a City - Players that purchase City Cards with the Build Cards will be able to piece the city together in any combination left to right or right to left. As players strive to get the better City Cards it may be necessary to discard unwanted or undesirable City Cards in the hopes of gaining a better one on the next draw.

Specialty Characters - Character Cards can be added to your city by purchasing them with the Build Cards and then placing them under the correct City Card they belong to. These cards also have a power point value so players can seek to add the best characters to their city to give it the best advantage.

Bonus Power Points - Saints Cards, Resources Cards, and Faith & Works Cards can be stored under Character Cards for later purchases of City Cards and Character Cards. Unused Build Cards can add additional power points at the end of the game.

Faggles to Faggles -- an outrageous, queered-up party game for you to enjoy with the girls. In this game of judging (hey, it's what gays do best), each card is more outrageous than the next.

Here's the deal: grab three friends or more and then draw a card with an adjective on it. The rest of the players, who hold cards with nouns on them, must play the card they think you would choose for that adjective. So, if you drew the card “racist” would you pick “the French,” “Miss Piggy” or “rainbows?”

Each card has a unique, hilarious definition that will keep you in stitches time and time again. A small investment of fifty bucks will get you hours and hours and hours and hours of entertainment. Believe us, we've played this game with dozens of people for hundreds of hours and it never gets old.

Wreck Age is a game/world, based on the imagination of two friends and a multitude of compatriots. A world in which you are able to tell your own stories and have your own adventures.

It's a tabletop game involving miniatures that you can collect, paint, and play with, as well as a role playing game; where your imagination takes you to new lands, and on adventures. Basically, make believe and craft night for adults all rolled up into one.

A tabletop wargame is a simulation; where models are used to represent forces on a field. Our brand of tabletop game is: part wargames simulation, part strategy game, and part board game. Like chess or risk, but which allows you to "color outside the lines" a little bit.

Wreck Age play occurs on a 2'x2' board (or larger), which can either take the form of a gaming mat, or just your kitchen table. The only limit to the size, and scope of the gaming surface is your imagination.

item.description:
Necropoly (Game of the Dead) is a spin on Monopoly but the differences are a dead giveaway. Two to six players make their way around the board beginning at Death and navigating through cemeteries and pitfalls trying to build up their stash of personal burial plots and even adding tombstones and mausoleums so they can charge more for other players standing on their grave. The “Fate” and “Communal Coffin” cards are hysterical. But beware the devil in one corner; he will send you straight to the fire. 
Players advance with the roll of the black dice, paying bones to the bone collector or taking in bones for fees, and the game ends when one player is the last to have bones.

A lot of cultures celebrate the dead with holidays like Halloween, Day of the Dead, and All Souls Day. This game is great for all ages and takes perhaps the scariest thing in life and makes it a fun and competitive adventure. The entire family will get into the spirit and will be laughing out loud.

Ethereal pirates swarm back and forth over each other's ships as the seas toss in the midnight storm. The decks of each vessel shift in and out of reality as the fighting begins. One captain and crew will emerge triumphant, and the loser will be damned to stalk the bowels of Davy Jones' locker.

Ghost Pirates is a tactical board game in which two ghost pirate Captains encounter each other on the high seas; based on old rivalries, grudges, or whatever it was that happened on Skull Island, they each turn broadside and lay-to. Each crew, following captain's orders, fights, fires cannons, and swarms their enemy's deck, attempting to force the other captain to walk the plank. Each player's turn consists of drawing a card, playing one or more cards to strengthen their ship and tactical position, moving your pirate crew, and finally, having them fight the foeman or take advantage and pillage the enemy’s ship. The goal of the game is to force your opponent’s captain to walk the plank.

Gameplay is designed to emulate tactical melee battles with a unique dice mechanic that is easy to learn and quick to play, especially for beginning gamers. It bears certain similarities to wargames like Axis and Allies, but on a much smaller, more fast-paced scale. The components are 72 cards which build the play layout and form the draw deck, 34 crew tokens, and a small handful of pirate themed six-sided dice.

Ghost Pirates was named to the 2014 GAMES 100 list, Honorable Mention, Family.

item.description:
It's barbecue time, so call your friends and tell them to bring the ingredients to grill!

In Grill Party, each player has a deck of twenty cards depicting the conditions for the meal – e.g., "More Steaks than Corn", "More Fish than Steaks", "No Fish", "More Wurst than anything" – and a set of wooden tokens: fish, corn, wurst and steak.

On your turn, you can exchange one token from your hand with one token on the central barbecue or in the possession of another player, then play as many cards from your hand as you can that meet the condition depicted. The first to rid himself of cards wins.

name.value: Royal Purple: The Game of Kings

item.description:
The unusual features of this game are the moves of the Prince and his acquisition of the territory upon which he sets foot. A Prince moves up or down on a dice throw of 1 or 4. Moves right or left on a throw of 2 or 5, and diagonally on a throw of 3 or 6. A player places a Dominion Marker on all squares stopped on by his Prince, and no other player may trespass on that territory when so marked. This limits the squares a Prince may move to making and unusual situation, and calling for increasing skill as the game progresses.

The person starting is determined by high roll. Turn moves to the left. Each player starts from his Corner Castle and is given a Prince, 30 Dominion Markers, and a die. Each player in turn rolls and places a Dominion Marker where the Prince lands. The first objective is to move to and place Dominion Markers on five Noble Squares (indicated by a purple board square with a white center). Then with the support of these five Nobles the Prince moves toward the Throne Space at the other side of the board. The first Prince to enter a Throne Space earns the right to wear the Royal Purple (wins).

The game plays like a cross between popular games of the day Chess and Halma with a roll and move mechanic added. A number of "Go To" squares on the board jumping players ahead to another square are an added twist.

Dungeon Delver is a single player, print and play card and dice game for kids. The goal of the game is to make it through the entire dungeon deck, battling monsters and surviving any traps you may encounter. There are many dangers, but don’t lose heart, because there are also useful treasures to be found along the way as well. You play as one of six heroes, each with unique abilities and each with high hopes that they will be the adventurer to complete the quest.
 The rules and 54 Dungeon Delver cards can be downloaded for free. Print the cards, cut them out, grab six "hit counters" (pennies, wooden cubes, etc.) and a set of rpg dice (d4, d6, d8, d10, d12 and d20) to start playing.

item.description:
The Sortie of the Prince of Wales and Repulse December 1941

Operation Matador is a historical simulation game recreating the Allied attempt to intercept the Japanese transports heading for the Malay peninsula during the opening hours of the Pacific half of the Second World War.

This game as two components a strategic move using a map of the pacific covering the Gulf of Siam and South China Sea, specifically covering Indochina with city of Saigon and Malaya with the city of Singapore. The ship to ship combats are conducted on a small hex map.

Victory points are assigned for the number of destroyed enemy air units, submarines, transports destroyers units destroyed. In addition points are allocated for shore bombardment and any damage to enemy carrier or battlecruisers. If the Repulse or Prince of Wales are able to leave the south or south west map edge.

You're the Banker is an educational game, designed to be played by large groups of students (up to 30 in 5 groups of 6). The game aims to teach the purpose and practices of the Federal Reserve Bank, by having teams of players run banks. Many of the consequences in the game are automated, but the teacher/moderator of the game is required to decide whether loans are sufficiently sound to accept as collateral for borrowing from the Federal Reserve.

From the TwoHourWargames site

The crowd packed the stands, all dressed in their finest clothes, a riot of color, pennants and banners flapped in the breeze, there was a clarion call of trumpets, and the crowd fell to a hush. In twos, the Knights paraded into the Lists, horses draped in color tossed their heads and stamped their hooves to the jangle of golden spurs. The sun shone in splendor on shield and harness. Passing the Berfrois the ladies and damsels threw favors of scarves and sleeves to their favorite Knights. The presiding prince proclaimed the rules, and the heralds announced their champions.

Joust-Heroes of the Lists allows players to re-create the combat between Knights during Tournaments. Each player builds his Knight using a variety of Attributes. The goal is simple, defeat your opponents in one on one combat and gain fame, glory and yes, wealth, as you fight your way to the top, the International Tournament Circuit where all Knights are champions.

Joust can be played solo against non-player opponents or head to head against your friends. In fact, you can even play on the same side, making Joust the prefect game to teach your friends and family.

Not the traditional wargame, Joust can be played in as little as twenty minutes and is perfect for campaign games as your Knight gets better with each win.

Joust includes the Jousting Field and six colorful Knight cut-out counters.

http://www.twohourwargames.com/joheofli.html

This game is available as a PDF download and/or Print and Mail from the publisher.

In Bookmaker, players bet on horses in a series of races. They're not concerned about which horse wins, however, so much as making as much money as possible from the bets they place based on which race cards they hold in hand.

Each turn is divided into two phases: the bidding and the race. During each race two players will be the bookmakers, the ones who set the odds on the four horses. At the start of the race, four race cards from the deck of 80 cards are turned face-up, while each player (including each bookmaker) is dealt four race cards face down. Players look at these cards to determine which cards are out of play – that is, which horses are less likely to move during the race. The bookmakers secretly exchange two cards each to give them extra information.

Then the bookmakers individually set odds on the four horses (1:1, 1:2, and so on, with the total of the second numbers adding to at least ten). They reveal these odds to the other players, who must then place at least one bet with one bookmaker. They can place more bets if desired, even with both bookmakers. Each bookmaker records the amount bet and the odds for that horse, and he can then lower the odds on that horse if desired (but if the total of the odds would drop below ten, he must raise the payoff on another horse. Players continue placing bets as long as they want.

Once all bets are finished, players remove all cards from play, then reveal cards from the top of the deck one-by-one, moving the appropriately colored horse forward one space for each card revealed. Whichever horse reaches the #10 spot on the track first wins. All players who bet on this horse are paid off in the appropriate amount from the bookmakers. During the race, the betters can ask for credit from the bank to spend and win more money – but of course in the end, they will be forced to pay the money back to the bank with interest!

After an agreed upon number of races, with each player being bookmaker the same number of times, whoever has the most money wins!

Variant rules in Bookmaker add wild race cards that move the horse which moved on the previous turn, a bet on which horse is the nag, and a harness option in which horses can break from the track and be disqualified.

item.description:
This fan made miniatures game uses the setting of Warhammer 40,000 but the game represents fights between squads with a leader and a handful of troops, each controlled individually. The statistics of each character are Grit, Fighting Value, Shooting Value, and Speed. Several scenarios are given or players can make their own. There is also a campaign system for linking battles.

The game turn is split into three phases- movement, shooting, and melee. The players alternate turns activating all of their figures in each phase.

Objective: 
be the first to let all of your 4 flowers (=cards) reflourish 
 - moving by turn -
all of the flowers fell asleep
each child tries to visit one of the elves
if this elf is matching with one of the 4 flower cards the kid started with, the card is going to be flipped (reflourish)

In the year 1939, the world was on the brink of the largest global conflict in history. War was inevitable. But how that war was to be fought had not yet been decided. Now you can take control of your military and industrial might, and truly determine the fate of the world from the very beginning of World War II!

Global War 1939 is a variant of Axis & Allies Global 1940 (Europe 1940 and Pacific 1940 combined), but it uses it's own map that has been completely redesigned showing the world in 1939. While the basic rules are the same, nearly every facet of the game now has added depth making it entirely unique including:

- A D12 combat system
- All new playable powers Canada, UK Far East Command, Communist China, Poland, Dutch, Romania, Finland, Hungary, Bulgaria, Vichy France, and Thailand.
- Country specific combat values
- New unit types
- New political rules
- New technology system and national objectives
- Optional air combat rules

Global War 1939 recreates World War II in it's entirety. The game board is a map of the world divided into controllable areas that have unique values. Players are divided between Axis and Allied powers to fight for global supremacy using a variety of combat units familiar to Axis & Allies players. Victory goes to the player/players that take control of a number of enemy Victory Cities.

name.value: Air Show: Circus of the Skies

item.description:
Every summer, crowds gather in the New Mexico desert for a show like no other. Daring pilots compete in exhibitions of aerobatic skill and bravery. Dogfights, air races, and bombing runs are guaranteed to test the mettle of even the most seasoned veteran. Have you got what it takes?

Air Show is a game and a game system. Take the controls of a stunt plane and put your piloting to the test in a variety of aerial events. Manage your altitude and airspeed, perform cool stunts to turn the tables on your opponents, think fast, shoot straight, fly true, and maybe you'll take home the trophy this year.

This game uses a simultaneous action selection mechanic to program a flight plan three maneuvers in advance. Players have thirty seconds to "lock in" their maneuvers and stake out a position in turn order. When everyone is ready, maneuvers execute in turn order. Planes may dive or climb, turn right or left, accelerate or brake, or perform a stunt at the expense of altitude or airspeed. The goal differs with each event, but strategies emerge from anticipating what other players are doing and planning around that. Unlike other games of this type, such as RoboRally or Wings of War, there are no cards to play. All maneuvers are available to all players at all times, to the limits of what their current altitude and airspeed allow.
This game was ultimately published by Goldbrick Games as "Rumble Pie"

name.value: Oil Quest: The Game of Energy and Excitement

item.description:
A game designed for group involvement. The object of the game is to get your drilling rig on the board, drill for oil and if oil is struck, replace the rig with a pump jack. Each time you go around the board you get revenue from each pump jack you own. When all the lease sites are allocated the game ends and the player with the most pump jacks is the winner.

Extra wealth can be gaining control of a whole section of the board. If you land on a square called "Option to Auction" you can place sites up for auction and get a commission for each site auctioned.

If a player lands on a Seismic Report he can drill for oil.

Only a thousand games have been produced with hand made wooden pieces.

A combination of chess and poker that uses standard playing cards for special effects. The chess pieces move as they would in an ordinary game of chess, with certain exceptions. Players draw cards from a standard poker deck on every turn. Different cards correspond to different playing pieces. The red cards correspond to the white pieces and the black cards correspond to the black pieces. Being able to form and play different Poker hands allows the players to do such things as teleport a piece or move multiple times in a row. For the white player, red poker hands effect the player's own pieces and black poker hands effect the opponent.

The effects of the various poker hands are potent, thus, the game is a much more tactical chess that is quicker, more severe, and with added dimensions to consider. Playing in the traditional sense generally does not work as the playing of the various poker hands change the traditional rules.

The game has 36 cards showing combinations of clowns in different colors. Move the cards always color on color in a row. Who has so placed as the first all his cards wins the game.

Simple observation and logical deduction game, better with more players.

32 Dice is a clever combination of strategy and classic chess-checkers play. Roll 16 dice to set up your board...flip to a different number to alter your move and be the first to move one of your die to the opposite side of the board to win. It is a clever new board game...easy to learn, and with loads of challenge for the more serious strategy players. First player to maneuver one of their dice to their opponent's back line wins. What will your strategy be... to take your opponent's dice, or defend the back line? A strategic flip of the dice instantly alters the direction and outcome of every game. Addictively fun for players of all ages. 
Wooden 4-piece game board is modular and stores neatly inside wooden box along with game dice. •Contents: Wooden storage box
 •1 4-piece game board 
•32 dice: 16 dark & 16 light 
•1 Rule book. 
For those who enjoy chess or checkers, this game is almost a must-have for your collection. A fun twist on chess, this game allows you to move your pieces in any direction (and look out for the option of a 90-degree turn of the die).

With this game the german quiz show "1, 2 oder 3" is coming to the nursery. Everyone has the opportunity to slip in the role of the quizmaster or the candidates and can hop around on the fields to collect points. Who is clever and the first player to eight questions answered correctly, wins the game.

name.value: Princess Lillifee: I pack my bags
Princesse Lillifee: Je fais ma valise
Prinzessin Lillifee: Ich packe meinen Koffer!

item.description:
Princess Lillifee would like to go on a journey and is packing her bags. Since she would like to to take so many things along, she takes notes on small pieces of paper. But where did she place all her things in her room? Can you help Princess Lillifee to find her stuff?

Components:
24 function cards
24 item cards
1 Princess Lillifee figure with base
1 Manual

How to play the game:
The youngest player starts. When it is your turn you show the top card of the function cards. It shows two or three things that Princess Lillifee would like to take along on her journey and which have to be packed into her bag. You have to try to reveal these items by showing the correct item cards. The order is up to you. If you make a mistakeand show the wrong item card with an item that is not on the function card, you turn only this item card face down again and it is the next players turn to try and find the correct items on the function card. As soon as one player has revealed all items on a function card, he can keep the card and as soon as all item cards are turned face down again, he can continue with a new function card.

End of the game:
The game is over as soon as all function cards are given out or if one player got 6 function cards. Now you count your points on the cards. Each item on a function card counts 1 point, so you have as many points as items on your function card. The one with the most points is the winner.

item.description:
(from the publisher's website:)

Ticonderoga simulates six engagements in the region between the upper Hudson and lower Lake Champlain, specifically the area between northern Lake George and Fort Carillon (a.k.a. Ticonderoga) during the French and Indian War (1755-58). The game system emphasizes the importance of leaders, and highlights the role of individual command skills, circumstances and luck. Throughout the game, leaders’ skills are tested as their units maneuver and fight, and every leader has the capacity to be “inept,” “capable” or “exceptional,” varying from engagement to engagement.

The game includes a lot of randomization; so every game may vary in tempo. One game may involve more soldiers than another, and often the quality of the lower-level (unnamed) leaders will be different. There are three campaign and three raid scenarios, featuring many units for the longer games and fewer for shorter ones (280 counters total). Each hex on the Strategic Map represents 1.5 miles, whereas each hex on the Tactical Map (for the area near Ticonderoga) represents just 400 yards. Individual units represent from 50 to 800 men, and leader chits each represent a single commander, sometimes a famous historical figure, at other times an unknown man of low-rank.

Designed by William Nester and Eric R. Harvey
Map design: Joe Youst
Counters: Trevor Holman

Objective: 
be the first to travel to your destination
 - moving by turn -
each player has to travel through 5 (different) cities in Europe along a given route
he/she memorizes the route - unknown to others - draws tickets, bonus chips, answers question cards, collect more bonus chips,... in order to move as fast as possible

1 board
6 meeples
51 tickets (grey)
14 trip cards (blue)
26 route cards (red)
65 quiz cards (yellow)
6 envelopes (for route card, tickets)
60 bonus chips
1 rule

The goal of the game is to utilize the deck of standard playing cards in order to be the first to get your four color-coded pegs all the way around the board, and finally back to your safety zone base before any other player.

Depending on the card you play during your turn, determines the amount of movement one of your pegs may move. Landing on an opposing players peg causes their peg to be returned to their home/starting location.

Some of the cards played have special abilities that can be used in a strategic manner, such as plying a 4, which allows one of your pegs to move four spaces backwards instead of forwards. You can also play a jack, which allows your to switch the places of any two pegs on the board, which do not even have to be your own.

Game Includes:
- Wooden Gameboard
- 16 Pegs of Four Different Colors
- Deck of Standard Playing Cards
- Rules Sheet

Mysterious spy organizations work toward world domination. It's up to "Lovely Agents", gorgeous news reporters and undercover police officers work with clever disguises to uncover corrupt plots and steal secret information.

Secret "Target" cards show the toughness and worth of an object. Players as spies try to take or keep these targets from each other. Players (all hot anime chicks of course) have protection cards (weapons, disguises, skills and events).

3 to 6 players with optional variant for 7 players who will target each other rather than an object.

The Grain Drain is a game intended to improve understanding of world hunger. At the beginning of the game, some players are randomly chosen to be rich countries, the rest are poor countries. Depending on this choice, players roll and move around either the "rich" loop track or the "poor" loop track for the rest of the game.

The object of the game is to avoid starvation: all players must be able to afford to feed their people once per lap of the gameboard, but because event squares on the "rich" track typically award greater amounts of money, "rich" players are less likely to suffer.

Part of the educational package [i]Food For Thought[/i] (1976), produced by Christian Aid jointly with Oxfam and the Catholic Fund for Overseas Development.

name.value: カードゲーム タイムライン

item.description:
Timeline: Events is a card game played using 55 cards. Each card depicts a historical event on both sides, with the year in which that event occurred on only one side. Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is removed from play and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.

Timeline: Events can be combined with any other title in the Timeline series.

name.value: Our Local Harvest 吾家吾農

item.description:
This game puts you in the shoes of fruits producers who are required to provide the most balanced possible productions.

Early in the game, the producers have no cards in hand.
In each round they have to choose between three possible actions:
- Take one of the four cards face up on the table (replaced by a new card from the deck)
- Draw a card face down from the deck, or
- Discard a card from their hand in the compost pile (more commonly known as the discard pile).

The goal is to form pairs of Fruits & Vehgetables cards of the highest possible values â€‹for each season throughout a round.

item.description:
This is a game for young children based on the story of Noah's Ark.

There are four identical boards representing Noah's Ark. The interior of each Ark is divided into 20 squares and each square contains the picture of an animal. Each player is given one of these boards.

There is a bag full of animal picture tokens. During a player's turn the child will remove one token from the bag at random. If the token matches an image on the kid's Ark, the player places it in position. If it doesn't match, the child loses a turn and puts the token back in the bag.

The first child to fill an Ark wins the game.

Designed for children 3 to 6 years old with no reading required.

Promotional game made by Black Cat cigarettes. It consists of 28 cards, but only 14 cards are used in any one game. Several games should be played to find a winner.

One player is elected Banker. He starts the Pool by placing 6 counters into it. He then shuffles and deals 14 cards face down. All the other players now place a bet (counters, not real money) on any card they wish. No more than one can bet on any one card. When all bets are placed, the first card is drawn. The player who bet on it must follow the instructions.

If the Banker role changes hands, a new deal shall be started. But Note: Sometimes a player's call against the Bank cannot be met. The deficiency is made up as far as possible from the Reserve. Then the Bank is 'broken' and the Bank role is transferred to the player on the Banker's left. This player starts a new Bank by putting in the 6 counters that are required.

Cards are:
One In, Two In, etc. = Player puts counters into the Pool
One Out, Two Out, etc. = Player takes out counters from the Pool
Reserve = Every player puts 1 counter into the Bank Reserve. This Reserve is set aside in a special pool, for use on special occasions. It transfers when the Bank is transferred, and only withdraws when Bank Holiday is turned.
Official Receiver = When turned, the Bank and Reserve (if any) transfers to the player who has backed the card, but that player pays over to the retiring Banker counters equal to the number then in the Pool (but not counting in the Reserve). The Banker taking over shall not scoop the Pool, which stays untouched and the game proceeds.
Distribution = When revealed, every player, including the Banker, receives a counter from the Pool.
Contribution = Every player, including Banker, puts a counter into the Pool.
Scoop = The player backing this card scoops the entire Bank, which now transfers to him. The Reserve remains untouched. He starts a new Bank with 6 counters.
Stake = This gives an advantage to the last player to have put down a stake of 6 counters to start a Bank. He claims 6 counters from the player who backed this card. The current Banker usually will be the one who staked the 6 counters into the Pool, but if a new Banker takes over because of the Official Receiver card or the Transfer Bank card (neither of which do not require 6 counters being paid into the Pool, so the player who benefits by this card will be the previous Banker perhaps).
Transfer Bank = The Bank transfers to the player who backed this card, but its capital cannot be increased or the Reserve interfered with.
Bank Holiday = The Bank's Scoop card. When revealed, the Bank scoops both Bank and Reserve, and starts a new Bank with a stake of 6 counters.

The game is a promotional game for BMW.

Objective:
Be the first to gain "required experience chips" listed on the 'task-card' you draw in the beginning.
Chips are handed out as a reward for correct answers on coloured areas. Questions are related to nature, BMW, environment, history of automobiles

item.description:
Objective: throw out all smoking monsters which have invaded (y)our home (cave) - or - enter the cigarette slot machine before all monster puzzles (20) are gone
 - moving by turn -
decide which die to use (3 red spaces = tough one)
roll the die and - let the monster puzzle grow (if red) or -
move as fast as you can from your cave to the slot machine;
on your way (different possibilities) you have to manage different obstacles like being caught (magic ring), releasing your partner(s), speeding (combining cones), answering questions (cards) ... 
content:
1 board
1 cigarette slot machine
1 cave
8 coloured little cones
26 yellow event cards 
24 red community cards
20 smoking monster - puzzle pieces 
1 "magical ring" 
1 die with 3 red spaces
1 die with 2 red spaces
1 rules (cover inside)
remark: promotional edition manufactured by Ravensburger

A card game that utilises the board that came with it but the host must provide other equipment.

It is a two player game (or 4 or 6, in which case the games is played as a partnership game).

The object is to fill your bucket or, at least, finish the game with the most water in your bucket.

Cards are laid from your hand, domino fashion i.e. as long as you match one of the numbers on the end dominoes, you can play that card. Most cards will say something like 5 Red Black 2. In this case, if you were Red, you would move your playing piece 5 spaces around the board. The spaces on the board let you add water to your bucket or cause your bucket to start leaking.

The game ends as soon as one player fills their bucket or it ends after both players have made two circuits of the board and then the winner is the one with the most water remaining in their bucket.

Thar be Treasure out thar for Take'n! Sail the Seas, to Raid Ships for Gold and Infamy, or plunder the Ports to get Pieces of the Map to Treasure Island. Collect 3 Map cards to find the Location of Treasure Island. That Island be tricky, and it's location changes every game. Only a Pirate with Maximum INFAMY (13 INFAMY Points) may acquire the Treaure Card from Treasure Island. A Pirate must move the Treasure to a new Location to keep it safe from other thieving Pirates to Win. There are 6 Possible Locations on the Treasure Card. Do all this while keeping a safe distance from the Powerful navy ships patrolling the waters. They don't take kindly to your "kill Em all, and Take thar Gold" Attitude.

Game-play lasts between 1-2 hours. A 3-5 Player game of Piratey Goodness! GOTO: dowrickGames for more info.

This is a set of rules for large (i.e., not skirmish) pre-gunpowder battles. Basing is given for 6mm, 15/20/28mm; 6mm uses 1/2 the distance of other scales. No army lists are included. No figure or stand removal is required when casualties are suffered; units become disordered, wavering, fleeing, and finally dispersed. Units may improve their state by spending one turn immobile and not involved in combat.

A typical game for kids (speed, fun and animals). Two frogs must compete to arrive first at the middle of the pond in a beautiful water lily.
Each player rolls a die and moves his frog on a track to reach the water lily. There are several dangers (snakes, humans) and distractions (flies, dragonflies) and some others cases give bonus to you frog.
This game looks like le "Jeu de l'Oie", but it is easier. But more important, it's game played by all kids in the northern provinces of France (something cultural, I suppose).
Material : 1 6-sided die, 2 tokens (frogs) and a board (the rules are printed on the board).

A children's game (speed, fun and animals). It's time to return home for a night's sleep, but it will not be easy with restaurants, concerts, rendez-vous and fighting with dogs.
Life is not easy for a cat.
Who will be the first to back home for bedtime ?
This game recreates the entire lifespan of a cat.
There are 6 cats involved in a race, each on its track. Each player rolls 6 dice and moves the cats by one case by matching die. Eg : If you roll 1,1,1,3,5 and 6, the cat # 1 moves 3 cases; #3, #5 and #6 move 1 case each. But be carefull with food, music, rendez-vous, whatever the number of dice you obtain the cat can only move one case by turn. And just before the finish line, there are dogs, the cat must jump over it to cross the line, it can't stop on it (2 dice are required so).
A funny game for rainy day.
PS : You can put candies on the play zone after the finish line, kids love it.

Plastic monkeys are flipped into a lagoon (the box with an insert). But when Elefun, the elefant, surfaces, he pushes some of them back out. Each monkey which is still in the lagoon now receives a banana and Elefun is submerged again. When all bananas have been distributed, the player with most bananas wins.

item.description:
This is a hybrid between Dominoes and Memory. In fact, the material is suitable for both games. The playing pieces are grey plastic units which have one nearly flat colored end with some 3D pattern, and one "diagonal" one.

- In ORY, the players place all the pieces into the box and pull out two of them at a time, hoping to find two in which the patterns fit into each other. Whoever locates most pairs this way is the winner.
- In DO, two random pieces are placed on the table. In his/her turn, a player tries to add a piece that fits the pattern and another one of his/her choice. A player who cannot add pieces has to draw a new one from the box. The goal is to get rid of one's pieces first.

Players take the roles of paleontologists; exploring several dig sites around the world, collecting fossils to complete dinosaur specimens and delivering them to museums.

The objective of the game is to gain victory points which can be gained by completing dinosaur specimens, claiming finished missions and selling fossils.

Each turn players can move their boats, dig to find fossils, buy fossils, load or unload their boats, claim a finished mission or take up new missions.

The game ends as soon as the fossil pieces run out, at which point the player with the most victory points is the winner.

item.description:
Genegrafter is a superhero card and dice game that was designed to be easy to pick up and start playing within minutes but still offer enough complexity so that more advanced players won’t get bored.

The core game is comprised of a deck of 54 cards that include Characters, Abilities, and Events. The goal of the game is to have more Genetic Markers than your opponents when the last DNA Strand is revealed.

To do so, you will have to make the best use of your Characters and Abilities as you draw them from the main deck (all players draw from the same deck). Game play is also randomly affected by Event cards that can completely change who is winning or losing. The core game includes hand manipulation, resource management (your Characters and Abilities), bluffing, and blind luck (dice and Event cards) which make each game interesting and unique.

Genegrafter is currently available only on Kickstarter and will offer customization and additional expansions.

item.description:
Come set sail with xPirate - the world's first-ever game that combines a traditional game board with the iPhone, iPod Touch or iPad! The iPad/iPhone/iPod acts as a "Game Master", controlling elements of what happens to the pirates as they search for buried treasure.

Object of the Game

Travel across dangerous waters on the hunt for 4 hidden treasures before sailing back home for victory!

Treasures - include gold, jewels, supplies & secret treasures.
Islands - while searching for treasure, you can trade on the island markets - buying and selling what you need to survive your journey.
Beware - you'll encouter raging typhoons, dangerous krakens, deadly ship attacks, skeleton armies and even attacks from your fellow players!

item.description:
Giant Battle is a 2-player print and play game about the brutality of the factions during the time where great wars occur to prove who is the better faction.

In this age of power and greed, every faction in the world are battling it out to find out who is better king among all kings. Players will take turns maneuvering their unit on the battlefield, making clever decision to eliminate the opposing faction's leader. And in this game if one of the leader of either faction dies, the game ends and the faction with the surviving leader considered victorious.

You will control either a dwarf clan or the orcs battling each other on a 5x5 board. Each turn player have 2 moves and 2 actions at their disposal. Some unit have special ability triggers by just be adjacent with their leader. Some unit have the ability to attack from afar and have the healing ability. Both player will try to eliminate opposing leader to win the game.

Visit us and play more games at http://experimentalplayground.blogspot.com/

item.description:
Packs Of War Each Rank 
 NON-Collectible Deck-building Tactical Military Card Game ==

 "INTRODUCING THE BUILD QUEUE" 
 REPLAYABLE 
Instead of a hand of cards, units come into play after being flipped faceup and waiting a certain number of turns in a Build Queue (BQ), think of an assembly line of four stacks of cards manufacturing forces. The way players manage their BQ greatly affects what units come out and when, which then affects their opponent’s decisions in <i>their</I> BQ. We are very proud of this innovation and how many strategies arise when deck-building. The more cards you flip, the more you reveal to your opponent.

 PORTABLE 
POWER is a card game played on a Battlefield, a 4×8 grid where unit cards are used as game pieces with movement and range as they engage in combat and advance towards the opponent’s Headquarters to victory. No board or mat is necessary to play, just your P.O.W.E.R. – Packs Of War Each Rank.

 SCALABLE 
5 GAME RANKS!! Earn your stripes as you ascend in level of experience and POWER®, starting at the Private Rank game all the way to Master Sergeant Rank – each Game Rank offering new ways to choose your cards and compete. Several expansion packs are already designed and ready for print!

 A.S.A.P. 
As SIMPLE As Possible! No rulers, no protractors, no terrain constraints (yet) – just a 6-way rock-paper-scissor-lizard-Spock mechanic and the BQ is all the complexity it needs to appeal to all gamers.

 >>> 2015 - DICE VARIANT ADDED 
We listened. Did the math. And responded. Look for the POWER DICE RULES VAR#1 card.

The Air/Sea Expansion packs will be released as print-on-demand through Drive Thru Cards.
More expansion packs planned come with equipment cards, different themes, time periods, nationalities, and realism.

item.description:
In the year 2149 a new gold rush has begun. This time the mineral rich lands are in the asteroid belt just beyond Mars. You and your fellow prospectors have gone in together on a Martian Processing Plant and you've each bought a mining ship to begin harvesting the riches of the asteroid belt. Although you may have bought-in together, you have no intention of sharing your riches with your competition.

This is a competitive game of resource collection and market management for 2-5 players. Each of you will manage your fuel, cargo, and the market to gain the most credits and win the game!

Players send their rockets to different asteroids around Mars and mine materials to sell on the Earth Resource Exchange. Players must keep a close eye on the size of their cargo hold, the fuel in their tanks, and actions of the other miners.

As you collect these materials, the other miners will know where to go to get them and you have to make strategic choices to decide where you will place your rocket and any revealed materials. Players trade materials in for credits, which they can use to buy upgrades and fuel for their rockets.

Objective: get as many coins as possible from the treasure of the bandit Hotzenplotz; game ends if all coins are gone
 - moving by turn, hide & seek -
game is split into different stages
each stage runs like:
1 one player hides the Hotzenplotz-tiles (traps, footmarks & treasure) on the board
2 other players roll 2 dice ==> subtract: difference to move;
choose, which of your meeples may walk; if you land on a symbol
3 flip a tile: trap ==> remove meeple; footmarks ==> all players know the symbol the must search behind; treasure; take two coins & and hide tiles for a new stage

Similar to Trivial Pursuit with 2500 questions and answers on seduction.
Players roll the dice, move around the board and answer the fun questions collecting the pieces of each color.

Love Trivia Gold is a real encyclopedia of everything you need to know. Over 500,000 games sold to date.

Players compete to create the longest path possible by laying tiles in front of their own tokens. Points are awarded for each tile traversed and the winner is the player who scores the most points.

The play is fast and simple making it a family friendly game.
